> Well I'm a lee player. Now you get a taste of what we feel daily :)

Lee was never bad though. He is also getting a buff soon so yeah. 

Yeah usually community hates champs will never be recognized as weak. (consider the uproar of Teemo buffs)

EDIT: Also Lee never really got the nerfs like Ahri did. Ahri's entire kit was nerfed over and over throughout seasons. So yeah, it is not weird for a champ to feel gutted when the champ was hit by nerfs for 2 seasons.

Lee was never good you mean. His winrate has fluctuated between 48 and 46% for years, with only a recent bout where he reached 52%.
And I'm not sure what you are insinuating by saying such things as Ahri has been "always good" for several seasons.

Compare that to Ahri which has had a consistent 52-54% winrate **FOR YEARS**.

You also really need to brush up on patch history as Lee has received far more changes than Ahri in the past 3 seasons alone, most of them actually nerfs. Looking at changes for Ahri alone, the bias is actually hilarious. Besides the recent number nerfs and buff to her E, there has only been bug fixes to her E dating all the way back to 4.12 where ** SHE RECEIVED A BUFF**.

and for you to say Lee never received nerfs like Ahri is completely biased. Lee has had his ult nerfed twice this season, both in damage and cooldown. The last time he received a buff was 6.14, and now again to the next patch.
Also, to add for the upcoming buff, it is so negligible I have no idea what everyone is so upset about. +20/15/10/5/0 to his shield. 20. at level 2. This in no way impacts his ganking and only his jungle clear and a little of his dueling capabilities will actually benefit from this change.

While they haven't nerf Ahri herself, Riot has made a ton of nerfs on mages in general, mana potions, removing items like Deathfire, removing the Mana spell etc. What would you do if they removed HP items from the game as well? can't even do first jungle clear. What would you do if they remove your jungle item? Then you'd be in the same spot ahri is right now. Which is "you gotta land all your skillshots and land them GOOD in order to stay alive and farm. Also Ahri has 3 skillshots unlike Lee who has one therefore it's much harder to play her.

TLDR yes Ahri didn't get too many nerfs but any nerfs at this points after digging the mages into the ground would make her and most of the other mages unplayable.

The idea that Ahri is harder to play is wrong in its entirety. Were she actually harder to play, either lee would have a higher winrate or her lower depending on which side of the that coin you flip on. You literally can't look at it any other way.

No matter how you try to spin in, amount of skillshots does not mean harder to play. With that take on it, i can easily say she is easier to play because her ult has 3 charges, dash freely (without a target) and has damage on all 4 abilities, unlike Lee. That is simply just wrong. There is far more to a champions skill floor and ceiling than the number of skills that do what.

So ahri is not hard cause her ulti has 3 charges? Makes zero sense. Akali has 3 charges on ulti and she is FAR more dangerous than ahri and also her 3 charges have a very short cooldown and can be cast individually as soon as they are up (once every few seconds) so your opinion on this matter is literally zero

Or maybe you completely misread it. Literally right afterwards I point out that such a comparison is wrong.
> That is simply just wrong. There is far more to a champions skill floor and ceiling than the number of skills that do what.
My point is simply that the argument "she has more skillshots" isn't an argument at all. Were that the case, Ziggs wouldn't be where he is now and udyr much higher on the list.

It's also a fact among even Plat+ that Lee is one of, if not the most difficult champion to play effectively. They hate Lee because a good one can literally carry a game. Those who do not play lee consistently understand the game and his kit well enough to still have a positive winrate simply because they are that good.

Okay I'll tell you what Ahri got nerfed in just 2 seasons:

Passive heal was halved.
Her Q is fine, got some mana cost increase
Her w range and base damage and ap ratio was gutted
Her e no longer stops dashes when it is a taunt.
Her r range and base damage and ap ratio was gutted

Lee Sin got ulti nerfs? Was every part of his kit nerfed? Did he get a range nerf? Hitbox nerf? Ahri has 52~54% winrate because Ahri was made into an easy soloq champ, that winrate is fine and balanced. An easy champ with that winrate means the balance is in good state. However, after her many nerfs after her winrate dropped to less than 50% winrate at diamond and above. 

Despite Lee Sin having a low winrate, he is still consistently picked in diamond and above and sometimes used in competitive as well. Ahri was fine and she was probably the most balanced champ in game. Her nerf in patch 7.11 was extremely unnecessary especially when there was tank meta + lethality item buffs or w.e that basically ruined Ahri all together. 

Also I am speaking from season 5, not before. Ahri before was considered weak. After season 5 rework Ahri did not get a single buff and was constantly hit by nerfs throughout all season for over 2 years. 

The fact that Riot is even thinking about buffing Lee Sin shows that they think he needs some assistent. Ahri needs it A LOT. 

https://lolalytics.com/ranked/worldwide/diamond/plus/champion/LeeSin/

^ If you look there best Lee Sin's have 58% winrate. That is a VERY good winrate. That shows that he does not need any buffs. If you are good with him you will probably win almost every game. If you are bad not really. I fail to see what makes Lee Sin worse than Ahri if it is possible for him to have such a staggering winrate.

https://lolalytics.com/ranked/worldwide/diamond/plus/champion/Ahri/

^ Ahri has 49.86% winrate in Diamond and above. This is a bad winrate for a soloq champ who is never picked competitively. Ahri's best winrate is at 55.30% winrate. That is SO LOW for a champ now that requires to land skill shot. Her nerf was aimed toward making her land skill shot more often, but even those who are really good with her who may land so many skill shots professionally ends up at 55.30% winrate. That is 2.70% less winrate than the best Lee Sin. Then he is getting a buff but Ahri is not? Psst. 

Ahri was balanced around having a high winrate. A high survivability champ should always have a high winrate because the champ will be present in more fights and will deal consistent damage(definition of soloq champ). However, low survivability champs will have less winrate because they will dish out WAY more damage than consistent damage dealing mage will ever do in a quick burst, and if they were to survive they will deal even more damage that will effectively make them extremely strong threats in teamfights. Ahri is not a threat at all. After Riot gutted her damage, her being alive will not change the outcome of fights at all. It shows in the winrate that she is winning less than losing. An easy champ like Ahri(her skillcap was destroyed in season 5) should never have a winrate below 51%.

I don't have much time to really present a full argument, but this part irked me the most:
>  That is 2.70% less winrate than the best Lee Sin. Then he is getting a buff but Ahri is not? Psst.

Firstly, you talk about ahri being balanced around having a high winrate and being an easy to play champion. With that in mind, you also understand that an easy to play champion will have a consistent winrate through all all leagues. This also means a more complex, harder to master champion, such as Lee, will have a far larger discrepancy between ELOs. With this discrepancy comes A higher potential, meaning someone who masters said champion will beat out an easy to play champion most of the time with the trade off of more skill and effort involved. This means a good Lee will have a higher winrate than a good Ahri, or at least should. Were he to have a lower winrate in every ELO, I can guarantee the buff would be far more significant

Once again, Lee's buff is minor. Very minor. Compare this to the last time his shield was buffed, where rank 5 afforded +80, far more significant as it was something he maxed 2nd after that point.

And to close this out, ahri is currently just below 51%. This is fine. If an easy to play champion has between 50-52%, then they are currently well balanced.
Compare this to garen and Annie, both at 51-52% and probably the pinnacle of simple champs.
If you want to talk about gutted easy champs, fiddlesticks is a good starting point, or braum, shen or karma. None of these champions are particularly complex yet have far lower winrates. This is gutted.
